meanings.definition: Of or relating to the design and arrangement of scenery in a theatrical production.
meanings.sent1: The scenographic backdrop added depth to the play.
meanings.sent2: The theater students learned about scenographic techniques.
meanings.sent3: The scenographic set fell apart during the play, creating chaos on stage.
meanings.sent4: Her room was a scenographic masterpiece, with every detail carefully planned.
meanings.sent5: The scenographic elements transformed the stage into a magical world.

meanings.definition: The art or practice of designing and arranging scenery for a theatrical production.
meanings.sent1: She studied scenographic to become a set designer.
meanings.sent2: The scenographic of the play was breathtaking.
meanings.sent3: The mice in the theater tried their paws at scenographic, but it ended in a mess.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a scenographic canvas, painting vivid scenes of the play.
meanings.sent5: The scenographic of the play brought the audience into a different reality.
